title: Broke rustc while refactoring method args in async yolo code

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: This happens with the latest nightly 2022-05-27 and 2022-05-14 ### Code https://github.com/gilescope/dotsamatown/tree/broke-rustc `fn process_extrisic` had 6 args and I was de-yoloing the code to have only 4 args when rustc got the right hump. src/datasource.rs line 810, if I change that call to process_extrinsic to have the right number (and type) of arguments then rustc gets happy again: ```rust let entity = process_extrisic(&relay_id, ex_slice,&extrinsic, DotUrl{ extrinsic: Some(i as u32), ..block_doturl.clone()}).await; ``` Sorry my yolo code broke rustc! I suspect it's pretty obvious what's broken. I don't think this is a subtle thing though I guess it probably is the fact that it's an async fn that helps brake it. ### Error output ``` Checking bevy_app v0.1.0 (/home/gilescope/git/bevy_webgl_template) warning: unused import: `FlyCam` --> src/movement.rs:16:19 | 16 | use bevy_flycam::{FlyCam, MovementSettings}; | ^^^^^^ | = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default warning: unused import: `subxt::ClientBuilder` --> src/main.rs:30:5 | 30 | use subxt::ClientBuilder; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_typeck/src/check/fn_ctxt/checks.rs:433:78 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/490324f7b29d5f1a1e063a563045d790091ed639/library/std/src/panicking.rs:584:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/490324f7b29d5f1a1e063a563045d790091ed639/library/core/src/panicking.rs:142:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/490324f7b29d5f1a1e063a563045d790091ed639/library/core/src/panicking.rs:48:5 3: ::check_argument_types::{closure#4}> as core::ops::drop::Drop>::drop 4: ::check_argument_types 5: ::check_call 6: ::check_expr_kind 7: ::check_argument_types 8: ::check_call 9: ::check_expr_kind 10: ::check_expr_with_expectation 11: ::check_match 12: ::check_expr_kind 13: ::check_expr_with_expectation 14: ::check_stmt 15: ::check_block_with_expected 16: ::check_expr_kind 17: ::check_expr_with_expectation 18: ::check_expr_kind 19: ::check_expr_with_expectation 20: ::check_block_with_expected 21: ::check_expr_kind 22: ::check_expr_with_expectation 23: ::check_match 24: ::check_expr_kind 25: ::check_expr_with_expectation 26: ::check_stmt 27: ::check_block_with_expected 28: ::check_expr_kind 29: ::check_expr_with_expectation 30: ::check_match 31: ::check_expr_kind 32: ::check_expr_with_expectation 33: ::check_expr_kind 34: ::check_expr_with_expectation 35: ::check_stmt 36: ::check_block_with_expected 37: ::check_expr_kind 38: ::check_expr_with_expectation 39: ::check_expr_kind 40: ::check_expr_with_expectation 41: ::check_block_with_expected 42: ::check_expr_kind 43: rustc_typeck::check::check::check_fn 78: ::check_expr_closure 79: ::check_expr_kind 80: ::check_argument_types 81: ::check_call 82: ::check_expr_kind 83: ::check_expr_with_expectation 84: rustc_typeck::check::check::check_fn 85: ::enter::<&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults, ::enter::{closure#1}, &rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults>::{closure#0}> 86: rustc_typeck::check::typeck 87: >::with_task:: 88: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 89: ::typeck note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.63.0-nightly (490324f7b 2022-05-26) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C opt-level=1 -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=1 -C debug-assertions=on -C linker=clang -C incremental -Z share-generics=y note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `datasource::watch_blocks` #1 [mir_built] building MIR for `datasource::watch_blocks` #2 [unsafety_check_result] unsafety-checking `datasource::watch_blocks` #3 [mir_const] processing MIR for `datasource::watch_blocks` #4 [mir_promoted] processing `datasource::watch_blocks` #5 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `datasource::watch_blocks` #6 [type_of] computing type of `datasource::watch_blocks::{opaque#0}` #7 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in module `datasource` #8 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
